title: San Juan National Historic Site: Photo Gallery
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     Photos & Multimedia     Photo Gallery              Photo Gallery                    1797 Commemoration Event   5 Photos  San Juan NHS and the Regimiento Fijo de Puerto Rico (a volunteer reenactment group of 18th century Spanish soldiers) were commemorating the successful defense of San Juan during the 1797 British Attack on Puerto Rico. On April 17, 1797, under the command of General Ralph Abercromby, the British made a third and final attempt to take Puerto Rico, the coveted Key to the Indies and Gateway to the New World, from Spain. (The first two British attacks on San Juan were in 1595, Drake and 1598, Cumberland.)          2009 Beach CleanUp Activity   17 Photos            Historic Photographs   4 Photos  Historic Photographs            Jr. Ranger Day 2013   34 Photos  2013 Jr. Ranger Day          Park Photos   10 Photos  Park Photos          San Cristobal Pictures   5 Photos  Different sections of the forts, tunnels and visitor center.            San Juan in B & W Exhibition   6 Photos  Lost History of the Fortified City - San Juan in Black & White Exhibition consists of pen and ink graphic reconstructions of ten structures in the Spanish defensive system in San Juan for the 18th and 19th centuries. The exhibit also includes historic and current photos, historic notes and a brief summary of the attacks on San Juan. This exhibition is located in Fort San Felipe del Morro.
